Hi

Great paper, it has finally got me off my backside to put HyperNeat
int=
o neat4j as I have tried to do exactly this, for Chess, using
regular neat =
and alpha-beta pruning.  The best result I got was a draw
with me (I am not=
 a good player) and I wasn't really concentrating -
so the fact that this d=
id very well against another, albeit, virtual
player is fascinating

My que=
stion is about the 3rd layer, the single node, what co-ordinates
do you fee=
d into the CPNN in conjuction with those that come from the
hidden layer?  =
All the other co-ordinates make sense, I just need
pointing in the right di=
rection.

Cheers

Matt

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kst=
anley@...> wrote:
>
> Jason Gauci and I are pleased to share with you new r=
esults with
> HyperNEAT  in our new paper to appear in the Twenty-Third AAA=
I
> Conference on Artificial Intelligence (2008), "A Case Study on the
> Cr=
itical Role of Geometric Regularity in Machine Learning."  The paper
> is a=
vailable here:
> 
>
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&=
task=3Dview&id=3D14&Itemid=3D28#gauci.aaai08
> 
> Or for a direct link:
> 
=
> http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/gauci_aaai08.pdf
> 
> This paper demonstra=
tes HyperNEAT in a more interesting domain
> (checkers) than our introducto=
ry papers from last year and introduces
> an effective method to evolve sub=
strates with a hidden layer.
> 
> Jason is also planning to release the sou=
rce code for this domain,
> although we do not have an exact release date a=
t this time.
> 
> Those familiar with AI conferences will also notice that =
in fact this
> paper appears in AAAI, which is more associated with mainstr=
eam AI. 
> That they accepted a paper in this area is a hopeful sign that
>=
 evolutionary computation and even indirect encoding can in fact
> succeed =
in the larger AI community.  We are grateful to the reviewers
> and chairs =
at AAAI for keeping an open mind.
> 
> Additional HyperNEAT publications wi=
ll be made available soon as well.
> 
> ken
>
